gold.user: As a project manager, I want to retrieve all available fields in Jira to understand what data can be captured in my projects.
gold.ideal: The response should return a list of all fields with their IDs, names, and types.

gold.user: As a product owner, I want to create a custom field for tracking user feedback so that we can gather insights directly from users.
gold.ideal: The response should confirm the creation of the custom field and return its ID and details.

gold.user: As a developer, I want to fetch fields in a paginated manner to efficiently handle large datasets without overwhelming the client.
gold.ideal: The response should include a paginated list of fields with metadata about total count and next page link.

gold.user: As an admin, I want to see all trashed fields to decide which ones can be permanently deleted.
gold.ideal: The response should return a list of trashed fields with their IDs and names, along with pagination details.

gold.user: As a team lead, I want to update the configuration of an existing custom field to better suit our project's needs.
gold.ideal: The response should confirm the update and return the updated field details.

gold.user: As a project administrator, I want to retrieve contexts for a specific field to understand where it is being used.
gold.ideal: The response should provide a list of contexts associated with the specified field.

gold.user: As a system administrator, I want to delete a custom field that is no longer needed to keep the system clean.
gold.ideal: The response should confirm the deletion of the custom field.

gold.user: As an admin, I want to restore a previously deleted custom field in case it is needed again.
gold.ideal: The response should confirm the restoration of the custom field and return its details.

gold.user: As a project manager, I want to move a custom field to trash instead of deleting it permanently, allowing for potential recovery.
gold.ideal: The response should confirm that the custom field has been moved to trash.
